articles.author: Andre Paultre, Maria Abi-Habib
articles.title: Kidnappers in Haiti Demand $17 Million to Free Missionary Group - The New York Times
articles.description: A gang captured a group of aid workers on Saturday and are holding 17 people hostage, including children. Most of those being held are Americans; one is Canadian.
articles.content: The gang, known as 400 Mawozo, controls the area where the missionaries were abducted in the suburbs of Port-au-Prince, the capital. The group has sown terror there for several months, engaging in ar… [+2797 chars]

articles.author: AnneClaire Stapleton, Tara John, Karen Smith and David Shortell
articles.title: American, Canadian missionaries held for US$17M ransom in Haiti - CTV News
articles.description: The gang that kidnapped a group of 17 American and Canadian missionaries in Haiti has asked for US$1 million each for their release, a top Haitian official told CNN Tuesday. The 16 American citizens and one Canadian were kidnapped by the powerful '400 Mawozo'…
articles.content:

articles.title: Two Brookhaven Lab physicists named APS Fellows - EurekAlert
articles.description: The American Physical Society (APS) has elected two scientists from the U.S. Department of Energy’s (DOE) Brookhaven National Laboratory as 2021 APS fellows. The honorees—Kétévi Adiklè Assamagan and Swagato Mukherjee—represent experiments, computational model…
